alert.note: Alert for Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 3:29PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cherry and east central Sheridan Counties through 315 PM MDT... At 229 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 25 miles north of Ellsworth, or 27 miles south of Gordon, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Big Hill, Intersection of Highway 61 and Survey Valley Road, Dipping Vat Meadow, Billys Lake, Argo Hill and Mother Lake. This includes Highway 61 between mile markers 182 and 188. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
